conbody.p: A Sub-pageflow State widget represents a subtask of the business activity that will be realized in the pageflow. A pageflow becomes a sub-pageflow when it is reused by another pageflow therefore, a Sub-pageflow State always has a reference to a pageflow. The referenced pageflow must belong to a project in a Design Studio (DS) workspace. During the execution, the sub-pageflows are linked to the main pageflow and together, act like a single flow.

Sub-pageflows can be used to abstract the details of a business activity, which will enhance their re-usability and save development and maintenance efforts. They should be autonomous and be able to receive parameters when started to facilitate their integration into other pageflows. For example, the construction of a financial domain can be detailed in its own dedicated pageflow, which can then be re-used in other pageflows calling financial functions on this domain as a sub-pageflow. Sub-pageflow States can also be used to break up the complexity of a large and difficult to understand pageflow into more accessible smaller sub-pageflows.
